snippet: The release of Latif Mehsud, who had been held by the Americans in Afghanistan, was ostensibly part of a process to repatriate foreign prisoners.
abstract: American military in Afghanistan releases Pakistani militant leader Latif Mehsud, flying him to Pakistan in move that officials say is part of process to repatriate foreign prisoners from American detention facilities in Afghanistan before formal end to combat mission there; circumstance also reflects thaw in strained relations between United States, Afghanistan and Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul, Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad, Pakistan, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The release of Latif Mehsud, who had been held by the Americans in Afghanistan, was ostensibly part of a process to repatriate foreign prisoners.

headline.main: U.S. Returns a Militant Leader to Pakistan
headline.print_headline: United States Returns a Militant Leader to Pakistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
